title: Alison Herring
subtitle:
When I met the family, I gave them a book of Hattie's letters that I'd transcribed, and they gave me a tour of the home where I described the events that happened there, recorded in rich detail by a war refugee they never knew existed.
2/3 pic.twitter.com/3A0qKpKGuN

title: Alison Herring
subtitle:
4 years ago I found the house where Virginia teacher Hattie Powell lived as a Civil War refugee. I contacted the descendants that still own the property by hanging a wreath on the gate containing a letter. This year, I'm spending Thanksgiving with them.
1/3 pic.twitter.com/zyMIHT64wB
